p: In contrast to the oligometastatic state, the polymetastatic state exists beyond the oligometastatic state, where widespread dissemination of metastatic cancer has occurred (i.e. non-oligometastatic, > 10 sites of metastases) [ 17]. Even with recent improvements to systemic therapy options for patients who have polymetastatic cancer, it is expected that a patient’s cancer will eventually become resistant to systemic therapy, necessitating a switch to a different drug regimen. Eventually, these patients exhaust all available lines of systemic therapy and will succumb to their cancer.
